üåßÔ∏è With #FloodWarnings and #FloodAlerts in place for parts of #Lancashire, watch our video for steps to stay safe before, during, and after a flood and see: https://t.co/8Oh91nEOml

Follow @EnvAgencyNW & @TheFloodHub for updates
#LancsAlert #StormChristoph https://t.co/jZHobb4Ds8

We know it will happen, yet we still manage the hills to give them the water absorption capacity of tarmac. Stop burning & stop over-grazing to ensure our hills can absorb these storms. Sandbags are not the answer. @EnvAgency @YWDirectors @WildlifeTrusts https://t.co/d5JSR8Ja5N

#StormChristoph is continuing to bring heavy rain across England which can lead to #flooding. Check your flood risk and sign up for flood warnings: https://t.co/MPz7FwsWeY  

#PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/O3zNENsUPo

With persistent heavy rainfall across the #Midlands today make sure you stay #floodaware 

‚ö†Ô∏èCheck your #flood risk: https://t.co/8HEpx2nkWv
‚ö†Ô∏èSign up for flood alerts:
https://t.co/4G9UCfW5wr 
‚ö†Ô∏è Call Floodline: 0345 988 1188

REMEMBER:‚ö†Ô∏è Never walk or drive through flood water! https://t.co/JoGOGP6DzU

Field team from the Kennet and Mid Thames team getting our pumps checked and running incase they are required in our area or elsewhere across the country .#preparing for storm Christoph #TeamEA .‚Å¶@EnvAgencySE‚Å© ‚Å¶@MarkHill03‚Å© ‚Å¶@sarahchareEA‚Å© ‚Å¶@wifo_ea‚Å© https://t.co/NpkbSOGXmr

@AndreasHeinem @RobStoneman @EnvAgency @YWDirectors @WildlifeTrusts Gosh its hard to keep up with the science! "Upscaled flow volumes indicated potentially significant reductions in downstream peak river flooding, estimated to be up to 50cm under mowing compared to burning" Heinemeyer et al 2018. Suggests a possible link?
Fast flowing and rising River #Wharfe at Burley in #Wharfedale. @itvcalendar  @EnvAgencyYNE https://t.co/uzNiUxRhLe

Please do take care in our park, we have had a lot of rain this week and some paths and areas are flooded.

There is a weather warning in place across Manchester due to #StormChristoph so please follow the guidance and advice from @EnvAgencyNW and @ManCityCouncil. 

Stay safe. https://t.co/gWKHpKl6h8

#FloodWarnings are in force across England as a result of #StormChristoph. #TeamEA have been working 24/7 to keep our communities safe. Stay safe at home and find out what to do in a flood: https://t.co/X4IQl3fUIh  

#PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/EkLRcEMncE

@powell_peter @NFUtweets @NFFNUK @EnvAgency @ORFC @DefraWater @Ruralpay @BenGoldsmith @DefraSoils @suesustainable That is shocking!

In this case is in an NVZ in England, in the @WGowyRivers patch.

It's chucking it down out there - take care, everyone. Follow @RMBCPress @EnvAgencyYNE
and keep checking here for the latest: https://t.co/aSNzPX1Jjv https://t.co/AyNva9Nis9

üì¢ Flood warnings are now being issued for parts of Lancashire, Greater Manchester, Merseyside and Cheshire meaning that flooding is expected. 

For the latest warnings visit ‚û°Ô∏è https://t.co/uGQ4g6A5Xn 

#StormChristoph #Lancashire #GreaterManchester #Cheshire #Merseyside

It‚Äôs wet, wet, wet across the #Midlands today (Wednesday). Lots of surface water on roads. Please don‚Äôt drive through #flood water. 30cms is enough to float your car. Keep checking your #flood risk. Latest update here 
https://t.co/4HSc5MbL20 https://t.co/fMneKq3b7w

‚ö†Ô∏èWith heavy rain set to continue and possible flooding in certain areas, @gmpolice have declared a major incident.

#StayHome Do not travel unless absolutely necessary.

https://t.co/XzFVKE67We https://t.co/EcZ7cCtbIA

tweets.text: My go-to places for my first update of the day on #StormChristoph - the @metoffice to check latest rainfall and @EnvAgency #FloodWarnings and #river levels on https://t.co/cr6aAwXvpg. It‚Äôs vitally important to stay #floodaware https://t.co/WZuK7F7u7U https://t.co/7W2m9pUUGV
Heavy rain is expected from #StormChristoph tomorrow - as always sign up to our flood warning service Stay #floodaware https://t.co/xE8Rupk4ct https://t.co/oo3py0fuT1

tweets.text:
As rain continues to fall on our wet river catchments, #TeamEA are out checking flood defences across the NorthWest

Here one of our operatives is monitoring the temporary defences at Burrow Beck in #Lancaster 

Check your flood risk at https://t.co/uGQ4g6RGOV

Be #floodaware https://t.co/6suQmFHZDN

Collaborative Procurement Symposium - 28th January at 10-11:30am

Join us for insight into procurement from some of the region‚Äôs most forward thinking organisations: @AskNationwide 
@SCFframeworks @EnvAgency

In collaboration with @WiP_SW  @leadersmeets

https://t.co/XARq3vUQkM https://t.co/F20Kkc0FV5

Early notification from @EnvAgency that #groundwater levels in the Chalk #aquifer of the River Ver catchment are high and still rising. Currently, considered a low risk of groundwater flooding https://t.co/7jzkLj2yE0

Our #Derbyshire field team have deployed some flood protection in #Bakewell in advance of #StormChristoph. Please abide by the Footpath Closed signs and do not put yourself at risk by climbing over the wooden boards. https://t.co/j1K3e6zSxp
Four flood warnings are still in place for Lincolnshire - here's an update from @EnvAgency. https://t.co/8Vj0bouGjR
